title: Kernel smoother
summary: A kernel smoother is a statistical technique to estimate a real valued function f : R p â†’ R {\displaystyle f:\mathbb {R} ^{p}\to \mathbb {R} } as the weighted average of neighboring observed data. The weight is defined by the kernel, such that closer points are given higher weights. The estimated function is smooth, and the level of smoothness is set by a single parameter. Kernel smoothing is a type of weighted moving average.
